The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The Surface Area of the earth is 197 million square miles, about two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish, it can swim at 50 kilometres per hour. Olympic gold-medal swimmers could not escape even if they tried, they can only swim at 8 kph (5 mph) .

Elephants demonstrate concern for members of their families they take care of weak or injured members and appear to grieve over a dead companion.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
Steve Wozniak designed the first Apple computer in 1976. It was known as the Apple I.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.

The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
